programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Jeffery Pyne was every parent's dream in so many ways, so many wonder what drove him to commit the brutal murder of his own mother.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Nancy Seaman doesn't denied killing her husband Robert with a hatchet; either she planned it or the murder was a desperate attempt to save her own life after, what she claims, was three decades of physical and emotional abuse.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Scott Amendure thought the "Jenny Jones Show" was the perfect place to reveal to his friend Jonathan Schmitz that he had a crush on him; three days later, Schmitz shot Amendure to death.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Dr. Jack Kevorkian thought it was an act of mercy to help over 130 terminally ill patients die a peaceful, pain-free death; Michigan prosecutors said it was murder and spent years trying to get a jury to agree with them.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: The defense hired a clinical psychiatrist to evaluate the mental wellbeing of the victim in his last days; Dr. David Schwartz confirmed that he noted the emotional state of Hyde while he was dealing with his terminal illness.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: The defendant's sister on the witness stand claimed that Dr. Jack Kevorkian has helped people facing ongoing pain and suffering to be free from their debilitating issues; Margo Janus read the report of past patients Dr. Kevorkian assisted.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: A month after Thomas Hyde formally asked and signed an agreement to end his life the defendant proceeded with the physician-assisted suicide; Dr. Jack Kevorkian's sister, Margo Janus, who worked with him, testified.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: Dr. Jack Kevorkian spoke on his childhood, young adult years and educational background; he then testified on the role of a pathologist toward their own patients; Dr. Kevorkian even gave his opinion on the Hippocratic Oath.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: On the stand Dr. Jack Kevorkian continues defending himself in his own trial where he's up for second-degree murder; he told jurors that Thomas Hyde was mentally competent when he wanted to end his suffering.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: Cross-examination began on Dr. Jack Kevorkian; he testified to jurors that Thomas Hyde was suffering from ALS, but that Hyde knew what he was doing; things got a little contentious at times between the prosecutor.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: Dr. Kevorkian claims organized medicine is socially criminal; he told jurors repeatedly that he only wanted to help end Thomas Hyde's suffering from Lou Gehrig's Disease.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: Doctor Jack Kevorkian read a form in court that Thomas Hyde filled out stating what he was going to do; on the stand, the defendant said Hyde did not want to die, he just wanted to end his suffering; Dr. Jack Kevorkian wrapped up his testimony.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: The jury listened to more DNA analysis of key Crime Scene evidence linking him to the death of Jennifer Fulford.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: The detective who Scott Nelson allegedly confessed to in the killing of Jennifer Fulford took the stand. After his arrest, the defendant apparently came clean to investigators on what happened and what he exactly did.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: During his police interview, Scott Nelson presented himself as the victim in this story. He was the homeless Felon on probation who had nothing going for himself.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: The State rested their case after playing back for the jury the confession Scott Nelson gave during his police interview.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Defendant Vents And Rants On The Stand
programme.desc: On the stand in his own murder trial, Scott Nelson admitted that he killed Jennifer Fulford but initially wanted to kill his federal probation officer, Julio Dominguez.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Scott Nelson had more to tell jurors on what led to him killing Jennifer Fulford. On the stand, he did not deny his actions. Instead, he wanted to make clear his true motive in this kidnap, robbery, carjack, and murder.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jurors listen intently to testimony about the minutes leading up to the first responders arriving at the crime scene; Jennifer McCabe is on the stand; she called for help after finding John O'Keefe in the snow.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Key Witness Under Fire In Cross-Examination
programme.desc: Karen Read's attorney is determined to grill the state's key witness; Jennifer McCabe shares her version of what happened, minute-by-minute, as they found John O'Keefe in the snow.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Karen Read's attorney had more questions for one of the State's key witnesses, Jennifer McCabe.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Karen Read's defense tried to discredit the State's key witness. According to Jennifer McCabe, the defendant was the one who admitted that she hit her boyfriend, John O'Keefe, with her car.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jennifer McCabe told jurors that Karen Read's SUV had a cracked taillight. She was on the stand testifying about what happened when she and Karen Read got to the scene and eventually discovered John O'Keefe in the snow.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: The sparring between Karen Read's attorney and the prosecution's key witness was not over yet.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Mary Kay Letourneau, 34 year-old married schoolteacher and mother, was having sex with a 12 year old student, and the story grabbed headlines around the world; it's only the first in a series of wild revelations.
